intro: Onagra hungarica, commonly known as the Hungarian false flax, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
